data.title: Stacks Of Squares And Crosses
data.statement:
Take an [[h]]*[[h]] grid filled with {{-}}.

[[n]] times, use the character [[a]] to draw the [[shape]] specified (either an up-down/left-right cross (for {{+}}), a corner-to-corner cross(for {{X}}), a square around the edges (for {{[]}}), or a diamond (for {{<>}}), on top of the existing grid.

Every shape is as large as the grid allows.

EXAMPLE:
`5
2
# []
@ +`
Step 1: draw a square round the edges of the grid with {{#}}
Step 2: draw an up-down/left-right cross with {{@}}. Where you've already drawn {{#}}, draw over it.

`START    STEP1    STEP2
-----    #####    ##@##
-----    #---#    #-@-#
-----    #---#    @@@@@
-----    #---#    #-@-#
-----    #####    ##@##`
OUTPUT:
`##@##
#-@-#
@@@@@
#-@-#
##@##`

testCases.title: It's Hip To Be One Validator

data.stubGenerator:
read h:int
read n:int
loop n read a:word(1) b:word(2)
loop h write scribbles
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> integer [[h]], the height and width of the output drawing
<<Line 2:>> integer [[n]], the number of shapes to draw
<<Next [[n]] lines:>> word [[a]] (the character to draw the shape with), and word [[shape]] (either {{+}}, {{X}}, {{<>}}, or {{[]}}), representing the shape to draw

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Take an h*h grid filled with -.

n times, use the character a to draw the shape specified (either an up-down/left-right cross (for +), a corner-to-corner cross(for X), a square around the edges (for []), or a diamond (for <>), on top of the existing grid.

Every shape is as large as the grid allows.

EXAMPLE:
5
2
# []
@ +

Step 1: draw a square round the edges of the grid with #
Step 2: draw an up-down/left-right cross with @. Where you've already drawn #, draw over it.

START    STEP1    STEP2
-----    #####    ##@##
-----    #---#    #-@-#
-----    #---#    @@@@@
-----    #---#    #-@-#
-----    #####    ##@##

OUTPUT:
##@##
#-@-#
@@@@@
#-@-#
##@##
Input
Line 1: integer h, the height and width of the output drawing
Line 2: integer n, the number of shapes to draw
Next n lines: word a (the character to draw the shape with), and word shape (either +, X, <>, or []), representing the shape to draw
Output
h lines: h-length string
Constraints
1 ≤ h ≤ 21
h is odd
1 <= n <= 4
Example
Input
5
1
# X
Output
#---#
-#-#-
--#--
-#-#-
#---#
